meanings.definition: The act of stretching or tightening something, such as fabric, on a tenter.
meanings.sent1: After the tentering, the fabric was perfectly stretched and ready for dyeing.
meanings.sent2: The tentering of the canvas ensured it would not sag when painted.
meanings.sent3: The tentering of the bedsheet turned into a fun game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the tentering of a bowstring, ready to shoot an arrow of success.
meanings.sent5: The tentering of the rubber band made it snap back with force.

meanings.definition: The process of making something taut or tense.
meanings.sent1: His tentering of the rope made sure the tent stayed secure in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The tentering of the guitar strings produced a crisp sound.
meanings.sent3: The tentering of the situation only added to the stress in the room.
meanings.sent4: The tentering of the relationship felt like walking on a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: Her tentering of the speech made the audience sit up and listen.

meanings.definition: The act of securing or fastening something in place.
meanings.sent1: The tentering of the latch kept the door firmly closed.
meanings.sent2: His tentering of the screws ensured the shelf would not wobble.
meanings.sent3: The tentering of the puzzle pieces together was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: Her tentering of the necklace clasp was like solving a tiny puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The tentering of the lock made sure the treasure remained hidden.
